Content:: Stage races Single-day races and Classics Alexey Alexandrovich Lutsenko (Russian: Алексей Александрович Луценко; born 7 September 1992) is a Kazakh professional cyclist, who currently rides for UCI WorldTeam Astana Qazaqstan Team.[4] In 2012 he won the UCI Under-23 Road Race World Championship.[5] At the 2015 Tour de Suisse, Lutsenko put in a sizzling attack after the penultimate climb of the day and it led him to victory on stage 8.[6] In 2019 he won the Arctic Race of Norway, the Tour of Oman, the mountains classification in Tirreno-Adriatico as well as a stage win and became the first non-Italian to win the Memorial Marco Pantani. In 2020, he was 3rd in the UAE Tour and won the sixth stage of the Tour de France.[7] The next year he placed 2nd in the 2021 Critérium du Dauphiné and won the ITT stage. He then finished 7th in the Tour de France. In 2022 his best result early in the year was a top 10 in the Vuelta a Andalusia. During the 2022 Tour de France he was outside the top 10 for most of the race, but climbed into the top echelon during the third week, prior to the final ITT. Former riders: list of riders
